title: Quantifying Credit Portfolio sensitivity to asset correlations with interpretable generative neural networks. (arXiv:2309.08652v1 [q-fin.RM])
abstract: In this research, we propose a novel approach for the quantification of credit portfolio Value-at-Risk (VaR) sensitivity to asset correlations with the use of synthetic financial correlation matrices generated with deep learning models. In previous work Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) were employed to demonstrate the generation of plausible correlation matrices, that capture the essential characteristics observed in empirical correlation matrices estimated on asset returns. Instead of GANs, we employ Variational Autoencoders (VAE) to achieve a more interpretable latent space representation. Through our analysis, we reveal that the VAE latent space can be a useful tool to capture the crucial factors impacting portfolio diversification, particularly in relation to credit portfolio sensitivity to asset correlations changes.

translated_title: 用可解释的生成神经网络量化信贷组合对资产相关性的敏感性
translated_abstract: 在本研究中，我们提出了一种新的方法，利用深度学习模型生成的合成金融相关矩阵，量化信贷组合价值风险（VaR）对资产相关性的敏感性。之前的工作中，使用生成对抗网络（GANs）演示了生成能捕捉到资产收益的经验相关矩阵中观察到的基本特征的可信相关矩阵。我们使用变分自动编码器（VAE）而不是GANs，以实现更可解释的潜在空间表示。通过我们的分析，我们揭示了VAE潜在空间可以成为捕捉影响投资组合多元化的关键因素的有用工具，特别是与信贷组合敏感性和资产相关性变化相关的因素。
tldr: 本研究提出了一种新方法，利用生成的金融相关矩阵量化信贷组合对资产相关性的敏感性。通过使用可解释的变分自动编码器（VAE）的潜在空间表示，揭示了影响投资组合多元化的关键因素。
en_tdlr: This research proposes a novel approach to quantify the sensitivity of credit portfolios to asset correlations using generated financial correlation matrices. By employing interpretable Variational Autoencoders (VAE) in the latent space representation, the crucial factors impacting portfolio diversification are revealed.
